definition: lit. the first person to bury funerary dolls (idiom)/fig. the originator of an evil practice
to begin/to start/then/only then
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
wooden figures buried with the dead

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: When actually, the instigators were you and your interest groups.
sentences.chinese: 其實，始作俑者就是你和你的利益集團。

sentences.english: On the contrary, it is condemned as presumptuous blame-shifting by the originator of the catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它被反斥爲這場災難的始作俑者的倒打一耙。

sentences.english: Many attribute property price hikes in recent years to property agents.
sentences.chinese: 近幾年樓價急升，地產仲介被視爲始作俑者。

sentences.english: Who is most probably the initiator of the pricing formula?
sentences.chinese: 誰最有可能是價格形成的始作俑者？

sentences.english: In chilies, capsaicin is what makes them spicy and “hot.”
sentences.chinese: 在紅辣椒裏，辣椒素是辣味的始作俑者。

sentences.english: Who is to blame for this mess?
sentences.chinese: 誰是這個爛攤子的始作俑者？

sentences.english: Mr. Fu sees himself as both perpetrator and victim.
sentences.chinese: 浮石認爲自己既是始作俑者，也是受害者。

definition: criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
chief offender/main culprit
criminal ringleader/chief culprit/fig. cause of a problem
to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
to reap what one has sown (idiom)/to stew in one's own juice
scapegoat/sacrificial lamb/same as 替罪羊
scapegoat
chief offender/main culprit
farce/CL:場|场[chang3],齣|出[chu1],幕[mu4]
beneficiary
notorious/infamous/egregious (bandits)
plot/conspiracy
to push the wave and add to the billows (idiom); to add momentum/to encourage sth to get bigger/to add fuel to the fire
